image.altText: An SA Housing Trust tenant outside a property.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide mum says she and her son experienced wheezing, dry-retching and burning in the throat after moving into a drug-contaminated Housing Trust property she was told had been cleaned and maintained.

title.children: Adelaide mum says Housing Trust didn't properly clean drug-contaminated property

image.altText: A sparkling sky with blue and purple tones. A brown sign says River Murray International Dark Sky Reserve

props.synopsis: Amid the global rise of "noctourism", the country's only officially listed dark sky reserve is working on an ambitious proposal for an underground planetarium and observatory.

title.children: Stargazers push for planetarium in Australia's only dark sky reserve

image.altText: A portrait photo of acclaimed American theatre director Peter Sellars.

props.synopsis: The Adelaide Festival is launching its line-up for its 2026 instalment, and the program will feature both fresh and returning faces, including British rock band Pulp, French actor Isabelle Huppert and American theatre director Peter Sellars.

title.children: Peter Sellars plots return to Adelaide Festival 24 years after controversy

image.altText: A church with a tall, narrow steeple under a bright blue sky with clouds. There are trees and green grass in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The tallest church in Mount Gambier will be sold so the congregation and its pastor can focus on their Christian mission rather than paying to repair its 154-year-old building's rickety steeple.

title.children: Heritage-listed church to be sold to avoid steeple repair cost

image.altText: The scene of a crash between a car and a Stobie pole.

props.synopsis: An allegedly unlicensed driver will face court after he crashed into a Stobie pole at Minlaton on SA's Yorke Peninsula, cutting the power supply to surrounding areas, police say.

title.children: Hundreds left without electricity when car hit power pole

image.altText: Man stands overlooking lake on platform

props.synopsis: Hard-working and charismatic former politician Troy Bell was so well liked, he was twice re-elected while awaiting trial for stealing public money. Now, he joins a short list of former SA politicians who have served time for crime.

title.children: Troy Bell joins list of jailed ex-MPs after abusing position of 'authority and trust'

image.altText: A silhouette figure of a scuba diver descends into darkness as a stream of bubbles rise into the light,

props.synopsis: A new documentary by director Jennifer Peedom delves deep into the attraction of cave diving, and why Richard Harris says risk-taking is crucial for resilience.

title.children: Why Thai cave rescuer Richard Harris can't quit diving

image.altText: A composite image of women's faces

props.synopsis: Meet the national finalists in the running for the 2025 AgriFutures Rural Women's Award celebrating change-makers in rural, regional and remote Australia.

title.children: Entrepreneurs and innovators vie for 2025 Rural Women's Award

image.altText: a person sits in the drivers seat of a car with a tv screen in front of them

props.synopsis: More than 20 regional NDIS clients have gone on to get their L-plates since completing a course with a unique driving simulator.

title.children: Kaitie was always told they would never drive. This new tech changed that

image.altText: Small and medium rise buildings on the edge of a city

props.synopsis: A scheme to increase housing supply by boosting confidence in apartment construction projects in Adelaide's CBD has been unveiled by the SA government as a major election commitment — but the opposition has questioned the affordability of the proposal.

title.children: Scheme to boost CBD apartments unveiled as SA election commitment

image.altText: A stage at the Harvest Rock music festival in Adelaide's eastern parklands amid stormy weather.

props.synopsis: A burst of stormy weather causes interruptions at Adelaide's Harvest Rock music event and the OzAsia Festival, amid more downpours in other parts of the state.

title.children: Storms disrupt Adelaide's  Harvest Rock and OzAsia festivals

image.altText: Fox standing in green grass.

props.synopsis: A nationwide program has traced how foxes spread from south-eastern Australia to as far away as the Pilbara in just 70 years, as part of efforts to revive native species populations decimated by the pest.

title.children: How foxes 'colonised' Australia in 70 years

image.altText: Overhead image of Glenelg's ferris wheel and palm trees and the roadworks

props.synopsis: Business owners along one of Adelaide's most renowned beachside retail and dining strips are making tough decisions to shut up shop as they fight to survive a perfect storm of downturn.

title.children: Beachside business owners struggle as trade wiped out by roadworks

image.altText: Murray Watt in parliament house.

props.synopsis: Opposition leader Sussan Ley wrote to the government on Sunday to suggest its environmental reforms be split into two to prioritise "practical measures to streamline approvals".

title.children: Labor rejects 'mad' Coalition idea to cut environmental reforms in two

image.altText: Australian Dollar coins and notes generic

props.synopsis: Top Chinese and American officials have held "constructive" talks ahead of a meeting between Trump and Xi. Follow the latest on our live markets blog.

title.children: Aussie dollar jumps on 'very successful' US-China deal framework

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: AI "hyperscalers" to deliever strong revenue growth as capex soars
Microsoft case not about price hikes themselves, says ACCC
ACCC chair Gina Cass-Gottlieb speaking on Microsoft

image.altText: Australian captain Pat Cummins looks at the camera in his team gear holding a cricket ball up.

props.synopsis: Pat Cummins is officially ruled out of the first Ashes Test against England, with Steve Smith named to step in as skipper in Perth.

title.children: Pat Cummins ruled out of first Ashes Test

image.altText: Li Qiang in a black suit, waving.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese meets with Chinese Premier Li Qiang on the sidelines of the ASEAN summit in Malaysia. Follow live.

title.children: Albanese meets Chinese Premier Li Qiang

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Albanese emphasises 'shared interests' at opening of meeting with Chinese premier
Albanese to meet with Chinese premier
No frontbench seat on offer for Joyce to return to Nats party room

image.altText: Three police officers outside the Louvre in Paris.

props.synopsis: One of the suspects was arrested at Charles de Gaulle Airport airport, with plans to fly to Algeria.

title.children: Suspects arrested over theft of crown jewels from Louvre heist

image.altText: A scenic tropical beach seen from a lookout.

props.synopsis: Wildlife rangers investigate a crocodile attack on a teenage boy at a beach in far north Queensland.

title.children: Crocodile mauls boy, 14, at Cape Tribulation beach

image.altText: Michelle Rowland behind a podium

props.synopsis: Labor has ruled out changing copyright laws to give tech giants free rein to train artificial intelligence models on creative works, after the proposition was met with widespread backlash from artists.

title.children: Artists rejoice as Labor rules out copyright carve-out for AI

image.altText: F1 McLaren car driving around a corner

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri has lost the lead of the Formula 1 drivers' championship, as Lando Norris wins the Mexico City Grand Prix.

title.children: Piastri loses lead of the F1 championship as Norris wins in Mexico

image.altText: Facebook smartphone app icon GOOD GENERIC

props.synopsis: Right now, more than 311,000 Australian Facebook users can apply for a slice of a $50 million compensation fund from tech giant Meta — the largest ever payment for a breach of Australians' privacy.

title.children: More than 311,000 Australian Facebook users can claim in this $50m payout

image.altText: Anthony Albanese shaking hands with Anwar Ibrahim on a red carpet with the ASEAN logo behind them.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese arrives in Kuala Lumpur, following in the footsteps of US President Donald Trump, who is also at the summit.

title.children: PM to discuss trade, Trump and security at ASEAN summit

image.altText: A grainy photo of a grey-haired man wearing a turtle neck sweater and a suit jacket standing in a room in front of a door.

props.synopsis: Israeli spy agency Mossad publishes details about an alleged Iranian official it claims is responsible for leading a unit promoting antisemitic attacks around the world, including in Australia.

title.children: Israel names Iranian it says is responsible for attacks in Australia

image.altText: Prince Andrew in ceremonial clothes looks out a rainy window

props.synopsis: It comes amid mounting speculation that King Charles III may force his younger brother out of his long-time home on Windsor Castle.

title.children: British MPs consider motion to strip Prince Andrew of royal titles

image.altText: A tree fallen on a fence.

props.synopsis: Some residents have recounted seeing family members lifted off their feet as what the Bureau of Meteorology believes was a tornado swept through Melbourne's western suburbs on Sunday.

title.children: 'Like stuff out of a movie': Tornado believed to have hit Melbourne's west

image.altText: albanese thumbnail

props.synopsis: The Coalition goes into the sitting fortnight managing grievance and division. Labor carries the weight of needing to prove it can manage the parliament. It is not hard to work out who you would prefer to be this week.

title.children: Environment laws are biggest test of parliament since Albanese's win

image.altText: Vanuatu's Prime Minister Jotham Napat and Anthony Albanese shake hands.

props.synopsis: Australia has cemented its position as the Pacific's largest donor by far as other countries pull back on lending and prepare to cut back on foreign aid, according to the Lowy Institute.

title.children: Australia's aid reach in the Pacific outstrips other countries by a long way

image.altText: On a dark blue gallery wall hangs a self-portrait by a 20-something Nora Heysen, dated 1936, where she holds a paint palette.

props.synopsis: At the turn of the century, Australian women artists travelled to Europe and returned with new styles and techniques. Their long-overlooked contribution to Australian art is celebrated in Dangerously Modern.

title.children: These women artists ditched the conservative local art world for Europe

image.altText: Two men stand posing for photos in front of national flags

props.synopsis: Former diplomat Lachlan Strahan used his memoir to criticise parts of the Coalition government's response to Solomon Islands' 2022 deal with China, while revealing some Australian officials pushed to impose "punitive" measures on Solomon Islands if it deepened security cooperation with China.

title.children: Diplomat's memoir gives an insider's look at Solomon Islands-China deal

image.altText: GettyImages-614068126

props.synopsis: An emotional Rex Ryan pays tribute to New York Jets champion Nick Mangold, who died aged 41 on the weekend.

title.children: 'Just way too young': Tributes flow for NFL champ after shock death aged 41

image.altText: Chess grandmaster sitting at a desk, playing chess online

props.synopsis: Former world chess champion Vladimir Kramnik has asked Swiss authorities to investigate threatening messages posted online following the sudden death of US grandmaster Daniel Naroditsky.

title.children: Chess grandmaster complains over online threats

image.altText: a woman in a wheelchair near a land cruiser

props.synopsis: A new survey lays bare what Occupational Therapy Australia describes as the "participation gap".

title.children: Leonie is among 7.5 million Australians who stopped work, hobbies due to health

image.altText: A man holds a surfboard covered in sea creatures.

props.synopsis: A barnacle-covered surfboard that spent 17 months at sea and travelled from Tasmania to New Zealand after it was lost off a boat appears set to be reunited with its owner.

title.children: Global surfing community unites in search for lost board's owner
